oai_dc:dc.dc:title: ASSESSING THE SPATIAL-TEMPORAL WAVE ENERGY CHARACTERISTICS ALONG THE SOUTHEAST COAST OF CHINA IN A WAVE SIMULATION STUDY
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Yang, Jie
Wang, Chen
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The objective of this study is to evaluate exploitable wave power in the South China sea, especially along the southeast coast, from a 10-year hindcast simulation of ocean waves. Based on wind speed and wind direction data from meteorological stations in the South China Sea, an evaluation of three reanalysis data products, namely ERA5, CFSv2, and CCMP, was conducted using correlation coefficients, bias, and other performance indexes. Overall, the wind field of the ERA5 dataset performed the best.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 38 (2024): Proceedings of 38th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Rome, Italy, 2024; waves.25
